meanings.definition: Having or showing a modest or low estimate of one's own importance
meanings.sent1: She is a humble person who never brags about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: He always speaks in a humble tone, never trying to appear better than others.
meanings.sent3: The humble squirrel tried to act like a lion, but everyone knew the truth.
meanings.sent4: Her humble demeanor was like a gentle breeze in a world of storms.
meanings.sent5: The humble flower bowed its head in the presence of the majestic tree.

meanings.definition: To lower in condition or rank
meanings.sent1: The defeat in the game would humble even the most confident player.
meanings.sent2: He hoped the punishment would humble him and teach him a lesson.
meanings.sent3: The arrogant knight was humbled by a simple farmer in a duel.
meanings.sent4: The fall from grace humbled the once powerful king.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism served to humble her ego and make her more grounded.

meanings.definition: To make humble in spirit or manner
meanings.sent1: The wise teacher humbled his students with stories of great leaders.
meanings.sent2: The experience of failure humbled him and made him more compassionate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was humbled by the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of nature never fails to humble me and remind me of my place.
meanings.sent5: The journey through the vast desert humbled the travelers, making them appreciate the little things in life.
